intro: Phaseolus vulgaris var. oryzoides, commonly known as the rice bean, is a leguminous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, elongated seeds that resemble rice grains, hence its common name. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with trifoliate leaves and erect stems. It produces pods containing 10–20 small, yellowish-brown seeds. This variety is valued for its nutritional content and is cultivated for both human consumption and animal feed.
